Description: Pottery wall fragment. Medium-fine (5 YR 6/6) clay with little gold mica. Purplish glaze. Exterior: wide stripes with pendent triangles; below, two bands above a triangle and three parallel diagonal lines. Interior undecorated.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 59, no. E 10, pl. 29, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HB.14) (Phase 3)
